events.name: Eat Out Tonight
events.description: Your friends have invited you to eat out tonight. You're super excited to go but you're not sure if you have enough money to go. Do you eat out or save your money

actions.title: Eat Out
actions.outcome: You ate out with your friends. You had a great time but you now have less money to spend on other things

actions.title: Save your money
actions.outcome: You chose the smart option and saved your money. You can now use this money for more important purchases. Plus you can always eat out another time

events.name: Repair your Refrigerator
events.description: Your refrigerator has started leaking out cool air and you need to get it repaired. Do you repair it or just leave it

actions.title: Repair Refrigerator
actions.outcome: You repaired your refrigerator. You now have a working refrigerator but you have less money to spend on other things

actions.title: Leave it
actions.outcome: You chose to leave your refrigerator. You saved money but now you have a broken refrigerator

events.name: Purchase a new Microwave
events.description: Your Microwave has stopped working and you need to purchase a new one. Do you purchase a new Microwave or go without one

actions.title: Purchase a new Microwave
actions.outcome: You purchased a new microwave. You now have a new microwave to use but you have less money to spend on other things

actions.title: Go without
actions.outcome: You chose to go without a new microwave. You saved money but now you don't have a microwave

events.name: Purchase a new TV
events.description: You've been using the same old plasma TV for years and you finally want to upgrade. Should you purchase a new TV or use your money elsewhere?

actions.title: Purchase
actions.outcome: You purchased a new TV. You now have a new TV to use and entertain yourself with but you have less money to spend on other things

actions.title: Save your money
actions.outcome: You chose the smart option and saved your money. You can now use this money for more important purchases

events.name: Purchase the new Games Console
events.description: Recently the new GameStation 6 has just released and you're super tempted to purchase it. It's a lot of money and you might need this money for more important purchases. Do you purchase it or save your money

actions.title: Purchase the GameStation 6
actions.outcome: You purchased the GameStation 6. You now have a new console to play with but you have less money to spend on other things

actions.title: Save your money
actions.outcome: You chose the smart option and saved your money. You can now use this money for more important purchases

events.name: You're running low on cash!
events.description: You've been spending a lot of money recently and with bills coming up you're running low on cash. Do you take some money out of your savings or do you risk going into your overdraft

actions.title: Transfer to Spending
actions.outcome: You transferred ${amount} from your Savings account to your Spending account. You now have more money for your bills at the cost of having less money in your savings

actions.title: Keep in Savings
actions.outcome: You risked going into your overdraft. You kept the money in your savings at the cost of potentially not having enough money for your bills

events.name: Time to save some more!
events.description: You have quite a bit of money in your spending account, why not transfer some of it to your savings account

actions.title: Transfer to Savings
actions.outcome: You transferred ${amount} from your Spending account to your Savings account. You now have more money in your savings at the cost of having less money for your spending

actions.title: Keep in Spending
actions.outcome: You kept the money in your spending account. You have more money to spend but you have less money in your savings

events.name: Save for the future
events.description: Currently you have a lot of money in your spending account. Why not transfer some of it to your Retirement Savings account for the future

actions.title: Transfer to Retirement Savings
actions.outcome: You transferred ${amount} from your Spending account to your Retirement Savings account. You now have more money in your Retirement Savings at the cost of having less money for your spending

actions.title: Keep in Spending
actions.outcome: You kept the money in your spending account. You have more money to spend but you have less money in your Retirement Savings
